svg.text: Mari Torii-Karch, Monica Wang, and Anna Kroskrity

div.style: font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 10px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4;

foreignObject.div: This study analyzed global mutation patterns in the HA and NA genes of Influenza A H3N2 to assess co‚Äêevolution and evolutionary rates. We employed multiple sequence alignment, phylogenetic tree construction, and statistical analysis (ANCOVA) to compare temporal versus regional mutation trends.

div.style: font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 10px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4;

foreignObject.div: Influenza A viruses are responsible for seasonal epidemics and occasional pandemics, causing significant morbidity and mortality worldwide. The hemagglutinin (HA) and neuraminidase (NA) surface glycoproteins are primary targets of the host immune response...

svg.text: Figure 1: Phylogenetic tree of global H3N2 isolates (2010-2022)
